name: adnanh-webhook
description: webhook is a self-hosted lightweight HTTP server that executes shell commands in response to webhooks. It allows defining rules and payload filters via JSON configuration and is controlled through CLI.

features.title: Webhook Support
features.description: Define custom webhook URLs that trigger shell commands or scripts when called

features.title: Payload Filtering
features.description: Set up rules to validate incoming webhook payloads before executing commands

features.title: Json Configuration
features.description: Define webhooks using simple JSON files with parameters, headers, and execution rules

features.title: Request Validation
features.description: Verify webhook authenticity using HMAC signatures, tokens, or IP whitelisting

features.title: Command Execution
features.description: Run shell scripts, system commands, or custom executables in response to webhook triggers

features.title: Environment Variables
features.description: Pass webhook payload data to scripts as environment variables for dynamic processing

features.title: Response Customization
features.description: Return custom HTTP responses with specific status codes and body content

features.title: Logging System
features.description: Track all webhook invocations with detailed logs including payloads and execution results
